title.narrative: Primary Health Project in Herat Province, 2015

description.narrative: The objectives of the project are humanitarian as well as developmental, consolidating the healthcare system established in previous project phases ensuring the basic human right to health for a population of 500.000 in three districts of Herat province in Afghanistan in consistency with the national healthcare guidelines specified by the Ministry of Public Health (MoPH) in Afghanistan to ensure sustainability. The humanitarian objective of the project has focused upon improvement of health and ensuring access to primary healthcare services with special focus on women¿s reproductive health and reaching the nomadic and remote areas' population through mobile clinics. The development objectives are focusing upon strengthening of existing healthcare systems through training and capacity development of Afghan staff as well as training of local community representatives/members in skills related to health and nutrition. Indicators for the humanitarian objectives are: number of population served by outreach and mobile clinics, number of births attended by skilled health worker, number of pregnant women attending at least one visit/service pre and post pregnancy as well as number of children under 1 year fully immunized. Indicators for the development objectives are: 1. Strengthening of District health systems in three districts with emphasis on training and capacity development of Afghan individuals and systems. 2. Support to local community health development through training of community members and representatives in specific skills relevant for health and nutrition. These objectives are monitored by the number of individuals attending specified training and the number of females as regular Shura members.
